urls.title: What is the minimum connecting time?
urls.description: What is the minimum connecting time? Minimum connecting time varies from one airport to another. The minimum connecting time for KLIA and our domestic stations is 60 minutes. However, it is advisable to allocate extra time for unexpected delays or any other unforeseen events Can't find the answer you are looking for? Ask us through one of the channels

data.text: @NiteshK53998188 Thank you for contacting us, @NiteshK53998188. Please be informed that the minimum connecting time at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) is 60 minutes, which is typically enough time to complete transit. Kindly refer to this link: https://t.co/tcnnpxZVA7. -SV
@SanatKu39952243 >> Kindly allow some time for the refund to be credited to your account. During this period, your patience is appreciated. -TS

@SanatKu39952243 >>However, the process might take substantially longer than that to process due to the high volumes of requests received. Therefore, we are unable to advise on the exact time frame for the process to be completed. >>

@SanatKu39952243 Hi, @SanatKu39952243. Our internal checks show that your booking has been placed in the queue for refund and is still in process. Please be informed that once the refund has been initiated, it might take up to 3-6 months to appear on the account. >>

@Jnanamurthy15 Hello, @Jnanamurthy15.

We are sorry to hear this. Please be advised that we have responded to your Direct Message. Kindly check your inbox.

Thank you.

Regards,
JC
@bxlkiss Hi, @bxlkiss. Thank you for contacting us. Kindly check your inbox as we have responded to your Direct Message. -MG

@princejainDCE >>
We would recommend that you contact our Mishandled Luggage Office (MLO) at the number given above for immediate assistance. -TS

@princejainDCE Hi, @princejainDCE. We understand your concern. However, we regret to inform you that we are unable to arrange a call back for you due to our limited accessibility here on social media. >>

@Jnanamurthy15 Thank you for getting back to us, @Jnanamurthy15. May we reconfirm if you have checked your inbox as well as the other folders of your email, such as spam, junk mail, or junk folder? Do let us know if this has been done and you have not found the email. -MV

urls.title: Lost & Found at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KUL) KLIA Terminal | Airports by Malaysia Airports Holdings Berhad
urls.description: You can call or visit our Lost & Found Centre to check for any misplaced items at the airport. For items misplaced on board the aircraft, please contact the airline you are travelling with. We strongly recommend that travellers take travel insurance to cover any losses that might occur. For items lost at the Airport Terminal

urls.title: Mishandled Baggage Forms
urls.description: Find deals and book great value fares to 60+ destinations worldwide. Malaysia Airlines is the national carrier of Malaysia, offering the best way to fly to, from and around Malaysia.

data.text: @princejainDCE Thank you for getting back to us, @princejainDCE. If you have not obtained a Property Irregularity Report (PIR) number, we would recommend that fill in our Mishandled Baggage Enquiry/Feedback form via this link:- [https://t.co/COD5Y00RWa].
@RizzoSheff Hi, @RizzoSheff. Please be advised that we have responded via Direct Message. -TS
@RizzoSheff Hello, @RizzoSheff. Thank you for contacting us. We do apologise for the inconvenience caused. Please provide us with the following details via Direct Message for our further checks:
@Jnanamurthy15 Hi, @Jnanamurthy15. Thank you for contacting us. Kindly check your inbox we have responded to your Direct Message. -QZ
@theyuvrajmodi You are most welcome, @theyuvrajmodi. Have a nice day. -SV
@theyuvrajmodi >> We highly recommend that you contact the local embassy and authorities for further assistance and clarification regarding specific entry requirements. -SV

@theyuvrajmodi << 3. Check-in baggage must be checked through to the final onward destination.
4. Passengers are only required to show their valid travel documents to transit within 24 hours in Kuala Lumpur and are not allowed to leave the airport building. >>

@theyuvrajmodi >> 1. Passengers are not allowed to clear immigration or any similar formalities in Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA).
2. Passengers must remain at the transit area/transit hotel while waiting for the next connecting flight. >>

@theyuvrajmodi << Do note the following directives from the Immigration Department of Malaysia on passengers transiting in Kuala Lumpur. All transit passengers must meet the below conditions and criteria: >>

@theyuvrajmodi Hi, @theyuvrajmodi. Thank you for contacting us. Kindly be advised that you do not need a transit visa if you do not intend to leave the airport. Passengers are permitted to transit through Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA).  >>

@princejainDCE Contact Number: +603-87772288
Email Address: KULLLMH@malaysiaairlines.com

For other local contact numbers for Mishandled Baggage department, you may refer to this link: https://t.co/tIPusJr36g. -NB

3/3

@princejainDCE We understand your concern, @princejainDCE. Can we confirm if you have received a file reference number or PIR number (example: KULMH12345)? If yes, kindly check your mailbox including your spam and junk folders for any updates from the department concerned.

1/3

A representative from our team will be in touch with you soon after, to follow up. Do note that >>

@SangeetaPurush1 Hello, @SangeetaPurush1. We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience caused. Please be advised that any lost/damaged/pilferage checked baggage must be reported immediately upon arrival at Mishandled Luggage Office, before leaving the airport. If you have not made a report and >>
@Jnanamurthy15 Hello, @Jnanamurthy15. Please be informed that we have responded to your message in the 'Direct Message'. Kindly check your inbox. -KS

@Ritesh68650127 Hello, @Ritesh68650127. We understand your concern. However, we are unable to intervene with a booking that was finalised by a travel agency. Any change and refund requests should be initiated by the travel agent. -DH

@Ritesh68650127 >>
Once your travel agent has submitted a refund request on your behalf, they would receive a Refund Reference Number (RAA). Kindly share your RAA with us for our further checks on your refund status. We would recommend that you contact your travel agent to obtain your RAA. -MG

@Ritesh68650127 >>
Your travel agent must liaise with the Malaysia Airlines Sales Representative from the respective country / local sales office. In general, a travel agent should have their own sales representative from Malaysia Airlines who will deal directly with the organization.

data.text: @Ritesh68650127 Hello, @Ritesh68650127. Thank you for contacting us. However, we are unable to advise you differently. As previously advised, bookings made through the travel agents must be referred to travel agencies for processing as only your travel agency can process your request.

@TheJayNirmal Hi, @TheJayNirmal. Kindly provide us with the following details with us via Direct Message for our further checks:

Passenger name:

We look forward to hearing from you soon. -LE

data.text: @bigbossjess Hi, @bigbossjess. Thank you for contacting us. We are unable to provide a specific date or time period. However, we would recommend for you to stay tuned to our official website at (https://t.co/ucux6yLDDu) or Malaysia Airlines mobile app for the latest update. -AZ
@nennehcherry Hi, @nennehcherry. Kindly check your inbox as we have responded to your Direct Message. -AZ

@NatashaAida >> We highly recommend that you contact the local embassy and authorities for further assistance and clarification regarding specific entry requirements. -LE
@NatashaAida Hi, @NatashaAida. Whilst Malaysia Airlines strive to provide the latest and updated information, we make no guarantee and we are not liable for any changes to the information. >>

@Emejotita82 >> at the airport. Our online check-in opens 48 hours and up to 90 minutes before your flight departure. Alternatively, we would recommend that you approach the staff at the check-in counter on the day of your departure and our staff will assist you accordingly. -JJ
2/2

@Emejotita82 Hello, @Emejotita82. Thank you for contacting us. Can we confirm if you are referring to a boarding pass? If yes, kindly note that you may perform online check-in then print the boarding pass and bring it with you on the day of departure to avoid any inconvenience >>
1/2
